lead_paragraph: In 2010, three villages agreed to give up their land to make room for a power plant, plunging the area into a battle over whether the plant would be a savior or a death knell.

headline.main: Bitter Debate Over Nuclear Power Simmers in Rural South Korea
headline.print_headline: Bitter Debate Over Nuclear Power Simmers in Rural South Korea

abstract: Yeongdeok Journal; residents of Yeongdeok, South Korea, are engaged in bitter fight over nuclear plant construction project; many have agreed to give up their land to make room for power plant with hopes of creating jobs and revenue, while others believe project would mean end to their centuries-old way of life.
